Case reference: 2014022855.CaseDesc: In February 2013, a human skull was turned into Hinton RCMP by the Groeneveldt family. They located the skull in their garage under items that had been tucked away since the homeowner Leo Groeneveldt passed away many years earlier. The family believes Mr. Groeneveldt received the skull as a gag gift at a party he attended in Hinton in the late 1960s or early 1970s. The exact origin of the skull is unknown. Forensic examination of the skull shows it is that of an aboriginal male.

Case reference: 2012020051.CaseDesc: Emily Ballantyne departed Lynn Lake the evening of April 27, 1991, heading to Thompson, MB with two male acquaintances. It is believed the trio arrived in Thompson late that evening, and they went their separate ways.  Ms Ballantyne has not been seen since and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: White, blue and pink on shoulder and elasticized waist

Case reference: 2016000962.CaseDesc: On January 5, 2016, Felix Claveau was last seen when he jumped off the Viau Bridge into the Rivière-des-Prairies in Laval, Quebec. Felix hasn’t been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002751.CaseDesc: Rebecca Guno was last seen in June of 1983 by her common law husband. Miss Guno was taking a bus downtown with an unknown female friend, but did not arrive at her intended destination.

Case reference: 2006017699.CaseDesc: Marianne Minor was a resident of the St. Thomas Psychiatric Hospital in 1984. She left her ward to go to the canteen and has never been seen again.

Case reference: 2016068443.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1980, an arm was recovered from Lake Erie, on the beach in front of 400 Cooper Lane in Amherstburg. The remains were thought to be probably female. The time since death is probably no more than one year.

Case reference: 2013000053.CaseDesc: On October 20 2010, OPP were called to the Iroquois Locks, Iroquois ON by the Captain of a Bulk Laker reporting that crew member Gary Charlton had not shown up for his noon shift.  Crew members and the OPP conducted searches of the vessel without locating Charlton.  He was last seen on the vessel by crew members at 4:10 a.m., October 20, 2010 when the vessel was in Lake Ontario in the Cobourg area.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2013000055.CaseDesc: Ronald Donelle has been missing since November 16, 2001. He was last seen dropping off his ex-wife in front of her home located in the Pierrefonds-Roxboro district in Montreal, Quebec. His vehicle has not been located.

Case reference: 2020051730.CaseDesc: On Dec 10, 2020, Gurpreet Singh Parmar was last seen on a video surveillance camera walking away from his family residence in Abbotsford, British Columbia.  Gurpreet has not been seen or heard from since.

Backpack: Other, Lunch bag or Lunch pail with shoulder strap
Hat: Other, Possibly wearing a brimmed hat
Pants: Other, Possibly wearing dark pants or sweatpants
Sweater: Other, Dark coloured sweater, hoodie or jacket, possibly red

Case reference: 2014005505.CaseDesc: Forrest Schab was last seen on August 13th 2010 in Mexico City, Mexico.

Case reference: 2015063998.CaseDesc: On October 6, 2015, Erin McGonigal was last seen leaving her home. Erin's home is located in the area of Dundas Street and Cawthra Road, Mississauga, Ontario.

Case reference: 2004005470.CaseDesc: Tamra Jewel Keepness disappeared from her home on Ottawa Street in Regina, Saskatchewan when she was just 5 years old. She went missing from her bedroom sometime overnight.

Pants: Denim, Blue, Pockets on the front

Case reference: 2014001522.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1977, James Stackhouse and a friend were camped on a small island on the east shore of Lake Winnipeg, north of Hole River where they were doing some mapping. Their boat drifted away to the south towards Deer Island located 3 miles south. At approximately 6:00 p.m. both men left the shore holding onto some small logs that they had tied together with their belts. They attempted to swim to Deer Island but the current and the waves carried them to 1/4 mile east of Deer Island. The bundle of logs that they had tied broke and the men were separated. Mr. Stackhouse's friend managed to swim to Deer Island but he did not see Mr. Stackhouse again. Searches of the area were done by land, air and water but the body of Mr. Stackhouse was not recovered. He is presumed deceased due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014003138.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1981, John Sanderson was with some friends in Berens River, Manitoba.  He left in a 22' boat heading for Jackhead, Manitoba.  Friends tried to stop him from leaving due to the high winds but he left anyway. On October 19, 1981, the boat that he had taken was found upside down and partly submerged near the shore of Pigeon Point. Gas cans that had been in the boat were also located.  Searches were done by air and water but the body of John was never found. It is presumed that Mr. Sanderson drowned.

Case reference: 2014004744.CaseDesc: Cyril Detimmerman and a friend left Brandon, Manitoba on the Assiniboine River traveling to Treherne. Cyril was experienced at navigating along this river route, however water conditions at that time had been very high as a result of the spring flooding. The pair soon encountered strong currents and large amounts of debris on the river. In the process of trying to navigate to shore the boat capsized causing both men to enter the water. Both men were wearing life jackets. Extensive searches conducted by land, air, water and dragging operations several miles along the river all with negative results. Mr. Detimmerman was never found and is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014004724.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2004, Corey Braun traveled from Fort St. John, B.C. to attend his employer's Christmas Party held at the Peace Valley Inn in Peace River, Alberta. On November 21, 2004, at 3:00 a.m., Corey was last seen walking to his room at the Peace Valley Inn by fellow employees. Corey has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Denim, Blue, light blue jean jacket

Case reference: 2012020059.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1967, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Sylvia Klayh was seen for the last time as she left her family’s cottage in Brereton Lake, Manitoba. Prior to her disappearance, Sylvia had a verbal disagreement with her father, and left the cottage without saying anything. There is a possibility of foul play, as she has never attempted to contact any of her family members.

Case reference: 2018009360.CaseDesc: On February 18, 1987, George Christie was last seen at the intersection of Broadview Avenue and Queen Street East in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010000299.CaseDesc: On September 3, 2009, Douglas Chong, 62 years of age, called his sister and advised he had attended the Toronto Western Hospital as he had not been feeling well. He advised he had been dehydrated and was sent to Seaton House to recover where he had been for three days and was feeling better. This was the last time anyone has heard from Douglas Chong. He has not retuned to his last known address. Neither Toronto Western Hospital nor Seaton House have any record of Mr. Chong having been there on or about the 3rd of September, 2009. There has been no use of his health or bank cards since September 3, 2009.

Case reference: 2020008361.CaseDesc: On May 12, 1991, at approximately 4:00pm, Ian Dickson was last seen leaving a restaurant near Yonge Street and Eglington Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Ian was visiting from Scotland, and was due to return on May 23, but he did not board his flight.

Case reference: 2014005412.CaseDesc: On March 2, 2010, Ian Murray was seen for the last time as he left the Mental Health Unit at the Cape Breton Regional Hospital in Sydney, Nova Scotia. During the time of his disappearance, Ian was suffering from schizophrenia and had stopped taking his medication.

Case reference: 2012020137.CaseDesc: On Friday September 27, 1963, Diane Carrier went to the neighborhood park in the Old Quebec district of Quebec City, Quebec, to advise her brother to return home for dinner. Her brother came home alone and Diane has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014006747.CaseDesc: Jian Ping Li and her 6 month old baby, Xiao Feng Lu, were last seen at their family residence in Brossard on April 30, 2014, around 9:40 a.m. When her husband returned, around 2:30 p.m., there was nobody home and the back door was unlocked.  Ms. Li's car was still at the residence. She left without her purse, her wallet, money, her credit card, and her cell phone, the diaper bag for the baby, the baby stroller and the car seat.

Case reference: 2014006252.CaseDesc: On September 12, 2013, Meagan Rose Pilon was seen for the last time at her family home in Sudbury, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Meagan was living in the New Sudbury area. Police have not been able to rule out foul play in her disappearance.

Mark: Left Chest, Red birthmark on inner left breast

Case reference: 2014003708.CaseDesc: John Kane was last seen March 29th, 1994, when he left his residence to go to work at the Saint John Regional Hospital. John never arrived for his shift, which was unusual for him. John was a heavy drinker and gambler. He would become depressed when drinking, and threatened suicide in the past.

Case reference: 2016061368.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1985, this unidentified male was found by a construction crew lying under a bridge at Spadina and Lakeshore Blvd. He was then taken to Toronto Western Hospital Emergency Department, where he never regained consciousness and died on April 17, 1985.

Hair: Grey, White, medium length hair; a grey moustache and a two-day old beard

Case reference: 2014002231.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1980, Heinz Gamper was seen for the last time when he went mountain climbing in Jasper National Park in Jasper, Alberta. Following this time, Heinz was scheduled to work, but he did not attend his scheduled shift.

Case reference: 2014004447.CaseDesc: On October 13th, 2002, Yvonne King was reported missing from the community of Fox Harbour, Placentia Bay. KING was last seen walking in the community.

Case reference: 2014002117.CaseDesc: On January 13, 1996, Michelle HARMER was reported missing by an acquaintance of the family who last spoke with her on October 31, 1995. The last contact Michelle's family had with her was in early November 1995.

Case reference: 2014006050.CaseDesc: On April 3, 2013, Mr. Patrice Mathieu was reported missing from his home in St-Joseph-de-Sorel. He was last seen the day before. Mr. Mathieu does not own a car, however he does have a driver's licence. Mr. Mathieu usually travels on foot. He is quiet and is, by nature, anxious and withdrawn.

Coat: Black, Mid-thigh length with a hood

Case reference: 2014003250.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1974, four people left the Whitedog Indian Reserve, Ontario in a 14' Lund boat and were heading for Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. Their intention was to go to Pointe du Bois to pick up supplies and then return to Whitedog. On November 5, 1974, these individuals were reported missing as they had never returned to Whitedog.  It is believed that the boat overturned and everyone drowned. Two bodies were recovered, and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. Searches were conducted by boat and by air but the bodies of Paul Scott and Richard Petawanahqueb were never recovered.  Mr. Scott and Mr. Petawanahqueb are presumed dead due to drowning. No foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2014004578.CaseDesc: Mr. Donald Tardif was last seen on August 7, 2003. He fell from his boat, a 14-foot motorboat, on Lake Devenys in the unorganized territories north of St-Michel-des-Saints. Mr. Tardif has never been seen since.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Calf, Tibia and perone fragments

Case reference: 2014000008.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2008, Christopher Hargitt, a resident of Vernon, BC, drove from Vernon to Vancouver. He was last seen by an associate, who was dropped off by Mr. Hargitt near the PNE Fairgrounds. On March 6, 2008, Christopher's vehicle was found unoccupied in East Vancouver, and he has made no contact with family or friends since that time. It is believed that Christopher may have run afoul of individuals involved in criminal activity, or fled the country to avoid these same persons.

Case reference: 2014001192.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1983, the partial remains of a young adult male were found on the south side of Cracroft Island. He was partially clothed in a wetsuit, and may have been out fishing when he went missing. The last joint of the little finger on his left hand was amputated. He is estimated to have gone missing sometime in 1982 or 1983.

Pants: Cloth, Gold, Small sweatpants with drawstring waist
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Little Finger, Amputation of left pinky finger

Case reference: 2014003132.CaseDesc: On December 29, 1978, Sharon Drover was seen for the last time. Ms. Drover left her boarding house located in downtown St. John's, Newfoundland and arrived for her evening shift at McDonald’s restaurant. She finished her shift after midnight.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2009004899.CaseDesc: Sacha Latulippe left Montreal Airport for Mexico city on October 15, 2009. He advised his family he was leaving for business. Investigation revealed he had 2 wives in different towns and was leading a “double life”. He left with his business partner Eric Marcel on this same flight. Mr. Marcel is also missing.

Hair: Blonde, Brush Cut, Spikey/gelled, natural brown; Sideburns

Case reference: 2019075256.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2020 between 4:00 and 5:00 am, Joel Judd was last seen leaving a party at a residence in Slave Lake, Alberta.

Case reference: 2005001499.CaseDesc: Lois was last seen shortly before midnight at the Village of Lucknow reunion dance on July 3, 1988. She left there and returned to her residence in Kincardine, Ontario where she resided alone. The police investigation indicates Lois was going through her usual evening routine before retiring. Lois, described as a devoted family person and a dedicated worker, failed to report for work on July 4, 1988. Her friends and family became concerned and notified police that she was missing.

Case reference: 2014005537.CaseDesc: Kerry Klyne was last seen while working at the Dakota Hotel.  Mr. Klyne's whereabouts remains unknown.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Tribal art/Band around biceps

Case reference: 2014006235.CaseDesc: A lake freighter capsized in a violent storm on Lake Winnipeg, just north of Hecla Island, Manitoba. The vessel carried nine crew members and one passenger. There was only one survivor who managed to float on a piece of the wreckage to safety. All of the bodies of the remaining occupants were recovered with the exception of Allan Clemens and Tache Everett who were never located. Autopsies confirmed that the causes of death for those recovered were either drowning or death due to exposure in the cold water. Mr. Clemens and Mr. Everett are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2008003599.CaseDesc: Charlie Campbell was last seen November 6, 1988 in Red Lake Ontario.  It is believed that he drowned.

Case reference: 2014006086.CaseDesc: Martin Geoffrion was last seen on April 26, 2013 in Montreal. He left his home around 4:00 pm in a Mercedes vehicle. On April 30, 2013, the Mercedes was located in a cul-de-sac in St-Roch de l'Achigan. According to his relatives, Mr. Geoffrion was not suicidal. He loved fishing and playing golf.

Case reference: 2006024599.CaseDesc: Chester Sawyers was last seen outside of a camp in Lochalsh (Riggs Township), Ontario on June 8, 1990.  It was reported that he was upset and indicated that he was heading home. It was believed that Mr. Sawyers left on foot and he has not been seen since.

Wallet: Brown, MasterCard, Canadian Tire Card, a driver's license

Case reference: 2006010199.CaseDesc: Mr. Donald Chorney was last seen leaving the Keys Lake Campground near Grassy Narrows, Ontario to go for a boat ride.  He has never returned and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2013000136.CaseDesc: Mr. Joseph Moore was last seen on October 31, 2012 by his employer in Kincardine, Ontario.  He was reported missing on November 12, 2012. Upon investigation, M. Moore's apartment was found neat and tidy and his clothing and luggage had been left behind. Joseph Moore is known to suffer from severe cases of depression. The last potential sighting was at the Kincardine Davidson Centre on November 8, 2012.  A media blitz was done to request feedback for missing person Joseph Moore with limited feedback. An extensive search of the area was conducted with negative results.

Case reference: 2014002336.CaseDesc: On March 22, 1993, Yolande Bouchard was going to meet her sister at the mall in Trois-Rivières at 4:00 p.m. She never arrived and was reported missing at that time. Her car was later found in Trois-Rivières Ouest with two offence tickets on the windshield.

Case reference: 2012020135.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1988, Melanie Temperton was reported missing. She left her residence located in Mascouche on September 21 around 9:00 pm to go to Montreal, where she met friends in different places. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020033.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1997, Daniel Gaulton went out with some friends to the Park Hotel. He had called his place of work to take the day off from his job as a security guard at a local construction site. At approximately 9:00 p.m. Daniel went to an ATM and withdrew cash. At around 11:00 p.m. he returned home. He had a brief conversation with his roommate, and left in his 1985 Chrysler LeBaron.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, head of a wolf (black) set in a moon (orange)

Case reference: 2014004736.CaseDesc: Mary-Anne Loranger, her husband and their baby were camping on Beckwith Island in Georgian Bay for an unknown amount of time, prior to July 31, 1970. In the morning of August 2, 1970, Mary-Anne Loranger left Beckwith Island with a male friend, Robert Lehto in a canoe. Their intended destination was Cedar Point, Tiny Township, Ontario. A storm occurred later that day and did not subside until August 4, 1970. It is believed the canoe they were in capsized at some point while they were on their way to Cedar Point.

Case reference: 2014001606.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1986, Sarah Pelletier was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. Witnesses saw her jump off the Jacques-Cartier Bridge into the Saint-Lawrence River at approximately 9:00 p.m.. Sarah hasn't been seen since.

Case reference: 2005006899.CaseDesc: On July 16, 1980, the skeletal remains of an unidentified man were found in a bush area on the east side of the 11th Concession, 1km north of Steeles Avenue in Markham. This man is believed to be between the ages of 30 to 50 years. His living height is estimated to be between 5'1"-5'5". Dark staining of his posterior teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. Found in the vicinity of the remains were some clothing and effects, which may or may not be associated with the deceased. The clothing found included a pair of "Brittania" women's jeans (waist 30 inches, inseam 29 inches); a pair of white, ribbed socks; and a pair of red and pink high-heeled shoes. A compact containing powder and mirror was also found nearby. This man was believed to have been dead for 6 months to five years.

Teeth: Some of his teeth have fillings and some appear to have been extracted a number of years before death

Case reference: 2014002505.CaseDesc: On January 27, 1988, Lisa Somerton was seen for the last time outside of her residence located at 1220 Merivale Road in Ottawa, Ontario. She was observed approaching a black sports car with two people inside.

Case reference: 2014006505.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2014, Sandra Mensah was seen for the last time in the Cartierville district of Montreal, Quebec. Her boyfriend came to pick her up at her home during the evening. Sandra has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005742.CaseDesc: Philip Mark Oslizlok was reported missing by his family in early 2010. He was last seen on September 2, 2009 when he went to the Vancouver Police Department to receive an employment record clearance. Mr. Oslizlok last contacted his family via email on November 20, 2009 to inform them that he had gotten a job on a cruise line and would not be returning home for Christmas. There are no records of employment for Philip at any of the cruise lines. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001392.CaseDesc: On March 31, 1994, Kuldip Singh was seen for the last time in Brampton, Ontario.  There is a possibility that Mr. Singh may be in the United States.

Case reference: 2014002270.CaseDesc: On 2 July, 1992, Behnam Amjadi was seen for the last time when he left his residence in the Côtes-des-Neiges et Notre-Dame-de-Grace district in Montreal, Quebec. Behnam has not been seen and has not contacted his ex-spouse or his brothers in Iran since.

Case reference: 2014002482.CaseDesc: On January 29, 1994, Hubertus Fischer was seen for the last time as he was travelling, by car, to Seattle, Washington. On February 16, the vehicle was found abandoned on a forest service road near Seattle. During the time of his disappearance, Hubertus was residing in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014002239.CaseDesc: On the August 24, 1993, Cynthia-Ann Peddle, commonly known as Cindy Paddle, was seen for the last time in Sept-Îles, Quebec. There is a possibility that Cindy frequented the area of Vieux Quai in Sept-Îles before her disappearance.

Vest: Red, Pink, T-Shirt, Pink or red
Pants: Denim, Blue, Faded Jeans, thigh pockets

Case reference: 2014005411.CaseDesc: On August 27, 1992, around 4:00 pm, Bernard Robitaille left St. Charles Boromée hospital after refusing treatment. He left on foot and has never been seen since. At the time of his disappearance he was carrying a Metro grocery plastic bag containing his personal belongings. The name and address of Mr. Robitaille was written on the bag.

Scar: Forehead, top of the right eye

Case reference: 1996004360.CaseDesc: Nina Akbarian may be in the company of her father, Naser Akbarian.

Case reference: 2016061231.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1968, an unidentified male was found hanging in a hotel room. He had checked in under the name Henry Drendorf. No identification was found. This individual was found with several bags of architectural books.

Case reference: 2014006541.CaseDesc: Roxanne Fleming has not been seen since approximately 1986.  Around the time of last contact, she spent time in Lillooet, BC, Kamloops, BC, Vancouver, BC, Red Deer, AB, and Edmonton, AB.  The circumstances of her disappearance are unknown.

Case reference: 2014001287.CaseDesc: Lawrence Wellington Allard was last seen in December 1975 in Kamloops, British Columbia.  Lawrence has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001146.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1974, the  remains of an adult male were found near Union Bar Road in Hope, British Columbia. He was 30-49 years old, had five simple dental restorations on the lower teeth and it is believed that he would have gone missing two to twenty years before his remains were located.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm , circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2012020071.CaseDesc: Richard Tssessaze's last known residence was in Brandon, Manitoba.  He had previously lived in both Thompson and lac Brochet.  Mr. Tssessaze was last seen in downtown Winnipeg in the area of the St. Regis Hotel, located on Smith Street, in late June of 2009.  Since that time, Mr. Tssessaze has not been seen or heard from, and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014001462.CaseDesc: Gareth Austin was last seen on August 17, 1995, and was last known to be in Medicine Hat, Alberta with Dominic Park.

Scar: Left Hand, Scar top of left hand

Case reference: 2018004583.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1953, Marion McDowell was seen for the last time in a parked car in lover’s lane in Scarborough, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, an unknown man opened the car door, and assaulted Marion’s date rendering him unconscious. When he regained consciousness, she was gone.

Chain: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, With a heart

Case reference: 2014005045.CaseDesc: William MORGAN was last seen during the early morning hours of October 28, 1968, at a cabin near Moose Mountain Provincial Park, approximately 12km north of Arcola, SK. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. MORGAN was planning to go out hunting in the area for deer. He had no vehicle and had a slow deliberate walk. A 30-30 rifle was also found to be missing from the cabin. Searches of the area have failed to locate any sign of Mr. MORGAN.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, blue flag and eagle

Case reference: 2012020075.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1974, Annie Yassie was seen for the last time by a taxi driver in Churchill, Manitoba. At that time, Annie was accompanied by a male friend.

Case reference: 2014005155.CaseDesc: Harold Murray Harvey was seen for the last time by a neighbour in front of his residence in Pincourt on September 14, 2008. Mr. Harvey was reported missing by a family member on September 19, 2008. At the time of his disappearance he was taking medication, which he left behind. Mr. Harvey had left his home a few times in the past but always returned after a couple of days.

Case reference: 2014005260.CaseDesc: On May 31, 2009, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Gordon Farrow was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Gordon advised that he was going to Sudbury, Ontario, but has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2008002399.CaseDesc: David Manuel Hannah was last seen in Kingston, Ontario, on January 4, 1983. Mr. Hannah was employed as a prison guard at Millhaven Maximum Security Penitentiary in Kingston. His vehicle, a 1969 blue Delta 88, with Ontario licence plate SYM 921 has not been located.

Case reference: 2014003507.CaseDesc: On February 5, 1991, Brian Adrain was seen for the last time. Brian’s abandoned vehicle was found west of Millarville, also known as McLean Creek, in the Kananaskis area in Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020138.CaseDesc: The 18 month old Yohanna went missing after the mother entrusted the custody of her daughter to her boyfriend while she was out of town for a few days. They all lived in the Saint Laurent area in Montreal. Upon her return to Montreal, the mother was told that her baby was in Washington with the boyfriend’s mother. She went to the United States to find her daughter, but could not locate her. Returning to Quebec, the mother alerted the police of her child’s disappearance. The boyfriend claimed then that the child drowned in the bathtub during the mother’s absence and that she had been buried before the mother’s return. He was questioned and then released due to lack of evidence.

Case reference: 2017015824.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2017, Hua Guo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020019.CaseDesc: Emerson Dobroskay, was last seen on October 28, 1988 at the Pit Pub located at the University of British Columbia. It is believed that Emerson may have fallen into a large pit dug for construction, but all searches have failed to locate him. Although foul play is not suspected, it cannot be ruled out.

Case reference: 2009002599.CaseDesc: Mark Mayhew was residing with family at a residence in Sturgeon Falls. He left overnight without notice. There was no incident which upset him and caused him to leave. Mark was on foot, he had no vehicle and no known destination.

Teeth: False, No teeth; had false teeth but was not wearing them at the time.

Case reference: 2020011631.CaseDesc: On January 29, 1975, at approximately 8:30 am, Simon Wilson was seen for the last time as he left his home for school in Toronto, Ontario. Simon did not arrive at school.

Case reference: 2020007795.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1972, at around midnight, James Edwards was last seen in his Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) uniform leaving for work in Toronto, Ontario. TTC advised that James had submitted his resignation before his disappearance.

Case reference: 2021008285.CaseDesc: Trenton Phillips was last seen by a family member at their residence in Red Deer, Alberta in the summer of 2017.  Trenton told the family member he was going to Kenya in Africa with Lifewater to build wells.

Case reference: 2012020061.CaseDesc: On the evening of October 17, 2008, Amber Mcfarland went to Smitty's lounge with her boyfriend and an acquaintance of his. There they socialized with friends for a while and then moved to the bar at the Canad Inn. They left Amber's vehicle at the Canad Inn and went to the Cat and Fiddle Bar where they continued to socialize. Video surveillance at the bar confirms that shortly after 1:00 am on October 18, 2008, Amber, her boyfriend and his acquaintance entered the attached beer vendor and purchased a case of beer. The three of them exited the vendor and walked into the parking lot. Amber has not been seen or heard from since. All of Amber's cell phone activity and bank activity has since ceased.

Purse: White, Black, Checkered or plaid pattern

Case reference: 2013000028.CaseDesc: Leonette Purcell has not been seen or heard from since she disappeared on December 16, 2004, from her Grand Lake home situated near the Halifax International Airport. The circumstances of Mrs. Purcell's disappearance are suspicious and foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2021037680.CaseDesc: Augustine Moloi went missing from Calgary, Alberta, in October 2008. Augustine's family has not seen or heard from him since this time.

Case reference: 2014005543.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Yellowknife RCMP received a call from a concerned family member reporting that they have not seen or heard from Kelvin Smallgeese since September 2010. At the time of his disappearance, Kelvin was believed to be residing in Yellowknife, Northwest Territories.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 6 teeth missing, 11 treated (occlusal) 15 unknown
Tattoo: Left Hand, A rose and a heart

Case reference: 2014006301.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2013, at 4:30, Alexis St-Denis was at his residence in Trois-Rivières. He sent a text to several people saying “Im so sorry”. Later on, a passerby found a cell phone, wallet, and headphones belonging to Alexis on the Pont de Fer bridge on the river Saint-Maurice near Highway 40. He has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2019000913.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2019, Daniel Hill was seen for the last time in Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005592.CaseDesc: The Timmins Police Service is actively investigating a historical missing person case involving the disappearance of William “Billy” Chookomolin. Mr. Chookomolin went missing from Timmins in the spring of 1995 at the age of 47.

Case reference: 2018022854.CaseDesc: Karrissa Koks was reported missing on April 30, 2018. However, she has not been seen or heard from by friends or family since October 7, 2017.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Changes hair style and colour often

Case reference: 2014001203.CaseDesc: On March 12, 2012, the body of a man was found in the ice of the St. Lawrence River near the Parc des Rapides in Lasalle. The man was not wearing winter clothes. A lighter in the right front pocket of his jeans was found.

Sweater: color burgundy with a collar and a zipper

Case reference: 2006013899.CaseDesc: Robert Heintz went missing from Kearns, Ontario on the morning of December 1, 1982.  Mr. Heintz went into the bush behind Larder Lake Public School with some friends and became separated from them.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2019040389.CaseDesc: On July 18, 2019, a rib bone belonging to a male wrapped in a t-shirt was recovered by a fisherman in the waters of the Strait of Georgia near Gibsons, British Columbia.

Shirt: Beige, Two eagles with "Gibsons, British Columbia, Canada" printed on the front

Case reference: 2020016353.CaseDesc: In April 2020, Travis Hollar last contacted his family. During the time of his disappearance, Travis was residing in Edmonton, Alberta, and was living a transient lifestyle. In the past, he suffered from a brain injury which caused diminished cognitive abilities.

Case reference: 2019078296.CaseDesc: On October 30, 1981, Erzsébet Tánczos Szita was seen for the last time at her home on Nun’s Island in Montreal, Quebec. That morning, Erzsébet prepared her husband’s lunch before he left for work. Later that morning, their housekeeper arrived at their residence for her last day of work, and subsequently contacted Mr. Szita to inform him of his wife’s disappearance. Erzsébet is of Hungarian origin.

Case reference: 2014001173.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1979, this unidentified individual was involved in a fatal motor vehicle collision near Wildwood, Alberta, and the remains were burned beyond recognition. The individual is believed to be a hitchhiker from Quebec, possibly named John. There are no dental restorations present and a few teeth had been extracted.

Jacket: Nylon, Black, Ski Jacket, Ski jacket with red and white stripes on the sleeve

Case reference: 2020007647.CaseDesc: On November 17, 1972, at approximately 6:30pm, Horace Brown was last seen by his wife in Toronto, Ontario.

Sweater: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, White, Short sleeves
